name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @Eric_Branch: Most professional athletes who come back from a major injury insist they never doubted they could return to full strength during their arduous rehab.

Kentavius Street is not that professional athlete.

https://t.co/DBfovTi69R #49ers https://t.co/tHmTBGWX2f

name: sfchronicle
text: FIRES UPDATE: U.S. 101 closed at Willits: The highway is closed due to the fast-spreading Oak Fire in Mendocino County “from its juncture with State Route 162 near Longvale to the North Willits on-ramp,” according to Caltrans. https://t.co/MmP7fgqNCC

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: Power will be cut off as early as 9 p.m. Monday to PG&E customers in parts of Sonoma and Napa counties, as well as those in at least 18 other California counties. Electrical services might not resume until Wednesday.

 https://t.co/GNegxu63gA

name: sfchronicle
text:
#SFGiants finally return to .500; subs Sandoval, Ruf spark key rally.

Story by @JohnSheaHey: https://t.co/s3zp4Ht6HV

name: sfchronicle
text:
PG&E power shut-offs: Here’s what you need to know and what’s new in 2020.

https://t.co/KpyLBrgTnl

name: sfchronicle
text: FIRES UPDATE: Heavy smoke conditions prevented a copter rescue of people trapped by the Creek Fire. Military pilots flying Chinook helicopters and using night vision attempted to rescue the trapped hikers and campers near Lake Edison and in China Peak. https://t.co/8B2TKU2bFr

name: sfchronicle
text:
How a hiking group outsmarted the Creek Fire, low-income Latinos hit hard by COVID-19, and a new round of power shut-offs.

Here's what you need to know to start your day: https://t.co/zcWl65wPDZ https://t.co/lwXohVmCSP

name: sfchronicle
text:
The first rounds of power shut-offs in Sonoma & Napa counties began around 3:30 a.m. Tuesday, when power was cut to nearly 23,000 customers. More than half of those outages — around 15,000 — were located in Santa Rosa.

https://t.co/byte4sGvUJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
Scores of hearts are being painted on some of San Francisco's public lawns, replacing the white circles that were the trial balloons in an effort to keep sunbathers 6 feet apart. 

https://t.co/c4KKxbM469

name: sfchronicle
text:
Marin County is largely white and affluent, yet Latinos account for nearly 3 out of every 4 coronavirus cases. No other Bay Area county has such a huge disparity. Now, public health officials are taking steps to fight back.
https://t.co/JGJ3kERJg2

name: sfchronicle
text:
When Stanford University abruptly announced in July that it was cutting 11 athletic teams, the athletes, alumni and supporters were shocked and disappointed. Now, they are compiling data, marshaling resources and fighting back.
https://t.co/DZYjhdxKwW

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/oRm1jgOUzL

name: sfchronicle
text:
Hikers are being evacuated after dozens were stranded at Vermilion Valley Resort. Hot, windy conditions Tuesday could continue spreading the explosive Creek Fire, which has burned 78,790 acres and is 0% contained. Follow our live updates for the latest:

https://t.co/IomBIFVmx5

name: sfchronicle
text: "I see internet access being open to public use the way phone booths once were." https://t.co/7YdqiVHbfb

name: sfchronicle
text: "There should be more permanent outdoor dining areas. I think people will continue to be weary and some will choose to continue to wear masks and not go to large gatherings for a while, even with a vaccine." https://t.co/6z4pVcwa17

name: sfchronicle
text:
Wine language is so often absurd that it’s a punchline. But now it’s clear that the language isn’t just intimidating and opaque — it’s also inextricable from racism and sexism.

https://t.co/kCcMLQdilS

name: sfchronicle
text:
"So much of what people dreamed or sketched seemed doable, it seemed like a possibility. And in that, it provided some hope for improvement." 

With Throughline wrapping up, we chat about the last two months of envisioning the future. https://t.co/djaCrjhuKL

name: sfchronicle
text: The disability rights advocate who uses a power wheelchair, Howard Chabner, sent an 11-page letter that made a case against a car-free San Francisco and included block-specific grievances — while still conveying an inextinguishable love for the city. https://t.co/2hMa9Y3kd9

name: sfchronicle
text: Just 16% of Marin County’s population is Latino, yet they make up a jarring 71% of its coronavirus cases. No other Bay Area county has such a huge disparity. https://t.co/De1cIvfWkw

name: sfchronicle
text: "I think it would be great for social workers to be the first responders in a wide range of situations. We also need a major revamp of police training." https://t.co/SCeyRA3eE3

name: sfchronicle
text: "San Francisco could be the city that is at the center of technology and be an unimaginable sci-fi thing in 10 years. I see all the potential from the creativity and tech." https://t.co/Pnh7TMx3TC

name: sfchronicle
text: Stanford University abruptly announced in July that it was cutting 11 athletic teams, and the athletes, alumni and supporters are hurt and disappointed. https://t.co/qZkKDtlruv

name: sfchronicle
text: Californians who worked part of this year in another state — to save money, be closer to family or for a change of scenery during the pandemic — may be in for a surprise next year when they file their taxes. https://t.co/MqYI9kDvil

name: sfchronicle
text:
Within days of Stanford announcing the elimination of almost a third of its sports after the 2020-21 academic year, backers began organizing — both separately by sport and collectively — to compile data, marshal resources and fight back.

https://t.co/3CscyWz1OJ

name: sfchronicle
text: The Dolan Fire has doubled in size since Sunday, consuming 73,089 acres in the Monterey Ranger District of the Los Padres National Forest and in portions of the Ventana Wilderness Area. The fire was 40% contained Tuesday morning. https://t.co/fSFpBBM09v

name: sfchronicle
text:
A Sausalito school was supposed to be one of the first public campuses in the Bay Area to reopen to in-person learning this fall, but it had to cancel class after a staff member’s COVID-19 test result came back questionable Monday.

https://t.co/R7Cph6x9By

name: sfchronicle
text: State officals have approved Santa Clara County to move from the purple category in coronavirus progress to the less restrictive red category under the state’s new tiered system of assessing counties for improvement against the pandemic. https://t.co/vef63S0LK5

name: sfchronicle
text:
Five California counties have been moved to the second (red) level of the four-tier ladder on coronavirus progress — with Tier 4 (yellow) being the best category with the least restrictions:

- Santa Clara 
- Santa Cruz
- Amador
- Orange
- Placer 

https://t.co/TdhyRW3B03

name: sfchronicle
text:
A’s third baseman Matt Chapman said he hopes to return as soon as he can from hip tendinitis but isn’t sure if it will be during this series against the Astros.

https://t.co/ZckBQjmO9n

name: sfchronicle
text: Santa Cruz County announced Tuesday that it is now allowing indoor operation of personal care services such as nails and massage, restaurants, places of worship, movie theaters, gyms and fitness centers, museums, zoos and aquariums — with modifications. https://t.co/lb3atwNIT0

name: sfchronicle
text: Californians who worked part of this year in another state — to save money, be closer to family or for a change of scenery during the pandemic — may be in for a surprise next year when they file their taxes. https://t.co/NKOYhugWe5

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Newsom said that the unprecedented confluence of drought, temperatures, lightning and other factors show that climate change is at work during this year’s devastating and early fire season. https://t.co/yaFl05BpCP

name: sfchronicle
text:
EA Sports announced Tuesday that Colin Kaepernick, the former 49ers’ quarterback, is returning to its popular Madden NFL video game series.

“The team at EA SPORTS, along with millions of Madden NFL fans, want to see him back in our game."

https://t.co/mw9NuPsx58

name: sfchronicle
text:
Santa Clara County announced it is moving ahead under its new “red-tier” coronavirus designation with reopening of indoor personal care, museum, fitness and shopping mall operations that the state allows, with capacity restrictions.

https://t.co/mtJXdsp4KZ

name: sfchronicle
text:
Santa Clara County has been approved to progress to the less restrictive red tier.

https://t.co/pV6cnsrHYz

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: San Francisco's coronavirus case tally has surpassed the 10,000 mark. The city reported another 52 new cases Tuesday to push its cumulative total to 10,031 infections so far. https://t.co/V84KJruIHZ

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Bay Area cooled off 20 to 25 degrees Tuesday following a record-breaking heat wave during Labor Day weekend. Red flag warnings for the North Bay Mountains and the East Bay Hills remain in effect until 8 a.m. Wednesday

https://t.co/Emq2OZXpz3

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Gavin Newsom said Tuesday he is “gathering information” about a large assemblage outside the Capitol this weekend in which thousands of people were reported tightly packed and not wearing masks as Christian musicians and speakers took the stage. https://t.co/eiFCCNxZnz

name: sfchronicle
text:
Bay Area generator sales are spiking due to power shutoffs, wildfires and a heat wave. This year, the demand is even higher with work-from-home and online schooling needs forced by the pandemic.

https://t.co/7Sjd6ntyr5

name: sfchronicle
text:
Tony Kemp is the A;s nominee for this year’s Roberto Clemente Award, given annually to a major-league player who exhibits “extraordinary character, community involvement, philanthropy and positive contributions” on and off the field.

https://t.co/BveDHX9hC2

name: sfchronicle
text:
Santa Clara County is loosening some restrictions after moving to the state's "red" reopening tier, but it's choosing to stick with a stricter local health order, prohibiting indoor dining, movie theaters and gatherings, including places of worship. 

https://t.co/jtL1X2iZF8

name: sfchronicle
text: Officials ordered evacuations of Berry Creek, Brush Creek and Forbestown and issued evacuation warnings for Feather Mills and Clipper Mills as the Bear Fire, burning in Plumas County, headed toward Butte County. https://t.co/E0GKUUhFzK https://t.co/dxuk1ij8SX
